“Listen to me, monks, I will instruct you,
Practice the Dhamma, all of you, that has been practiced;
The conduct that is suitable for those gone forth,
The one who gives the benefit should follow it, the wise one.
A monk should not wander at the wrong time,
And should wander in the village for alms at the right time;
For conflicts arise for one who wanders at the wrong time,
Therefore the Buddhas do not wander at the wrong time.

Thinking internally, not externally,

but we do not praise the limited-witted.
